title: 114_s683
content: The "Compassionate Access, Research Expansion, and Respect States Act of 2015" or the "CARERS Act of 2015" amends the Controlled Substances Act to allow compliance with state laws regarding medical marijuana. It also addresses the rescheduling of marijuana. SEC. 3 of the "CARERS Act of 2015" amends the Controlled Substances Act by removing marijuana from Schedule I and listing it in Schedule II. SEC. 4 excludes cannabidiol from the definition of marijuana. SEC. 4 amends the Controlled Substances Act to exclude cannabidiol from the definition of marijuana. It defines cannabidiol as a substance derived from marijuana or synthetic formulation containing no more than 0.3% delta-9-tetrahydrocannabinol on a dry weight basis. SEC. 5 amends the Controlled Substances Act to allow states to determine cannabidiol concentration for marijuana grown or processed for cannabidiol production. SEC. 6 addresses banking issues related to marijuana businesses. In this section, "depository institution" is defined as a bank, credit union, or other financial institution. The term "Federal banking regulator" refers to various federal agencies overseeing banking activities. The curr_chunk defines terms related to financial services, manufacturers, and marijuana-related legitimate businesses. It specifies that a financial service is defined in the Dodd-Frank Act, a manufacturer is someone involved in processing marijuana, and a marijuana-related legitimate business includes activities like selling and distributing marijuana products. The curr_chunk defines terms related to marijuana, including the definition of marijuana, marijuana products, producer, and State. The curr_chunk discusses the safe harbor for depository institutions in providing financial services to marijuana-related legitimate businesses, prohibiting regulators from terminating deposit insurance or discouraging such services. The curr_chunk prohibits depository institutions from taking adverse actions against individuals involved in marijuana-related legitimate businesses, including cancelling services or taking supervisory actions on loans solely based on their association with the industry. The curr_chunk provides protections under federal law for depository institutions that offer financial services to marijuana-related legitimate businesses, granting immunity from federal criminal prosecution or investigation. Depository institutions offering financial services to marijuana-related legitimate businesses are protected from criminal penalties or forfeiture under federal law. Additionally, they are exempt from filing suspicious activity reports related to such businesses. The Secretary requires financial institutions to report suspicious transactions related to marijuana businesses in compliance with specific guidance. However, depository institutions are not obligated to provide financial services to such businesses. SEC. 7. RESEARCH. The Secretary for Health and Human Services will terminate the Public Health Service interdisciplinary review process for marijuana research. Licenses for marijuana research will be issued by the Attorney General within a year. SEC. 8. The Department of Veterans Affairs health care providers can provide recommendations on veteran participation in state marijuana programs. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs can authorize VA health care providers to give recommendations and opinions to veterans in states with marijuana programs, and complete related forms.
